org.codehaus.mojo.buildhelper

Class FixtureUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codehaus.mojo.buildhelper.FixtureUtils

  • public final class FixtureUtils
extends Object
    A utility class for managing test resources.
    Since:
    1.12
    Author:
    Adrian Price demonfiddler@virginmedia.com

    • Method Detail

      • createResources

        public static void createResources(String basePath)
                            throws IOException
        Creates test resources defined by the specification file fixture.properties. The method creates all the files named by the properties, optionally setting the modification timestamp by adding the number of seconds specified by the property value (which must be an integer) to the current system time.
        Parameters:
        basePath - The path to the base directory against which to resolve relative paths (including fixture.properties).
        Throws:
        IOException - If unable to create a file or a missing parent directory.
        NumberFormatException - If a non-empty property value cannot be parsed as an integer.

      • createResources

        public static void createResources(File baseDir,
                                   String propertiesPath,
                                   String encoding,
                                   long baseTimestamp)
                            throws IOException
        Creates test resources defined by a specification file. The method creates all the files named by the properties, optionally setting the modification timestamp by adding the number of seconds specified by the property value (which must be an integer) to a base timestamp.
        Parameters:
        baseDir - The base directory against which to resolve relative paths.
        propertiesPath - The path (relative or absolute) to a Properties file whose property names are file paths (relative or absolute) and whose optional property values represent relative modification timestamps in seconds.
        baseTimestamp - The base timestamp to use, in milliseconds since midnight on the 1st January 1970 GMT.
        encoding - Encoding.
        Throws:
        IOException - If unable to create a file or a missing parent directory.
        NumberFormatException - If a non-empty property value cannot be parsed as an integer.

      • createResources

        public static void createResources(File baseDir,
                                   File propertiesFile,
                                   String encoding,
                                   long baseTimestamp)
                            throws IOException
        Creates test resources defined by a specification file. The method creates all the files named by the properties, optionally setting the modification timestamp by adding the number of seconds specified by the property value (which must be an integer) to a base timestamp.
        Parameters:
        baseDir - The base directory against which to resolve relative paths.
        propertiesFile - A Properties file whose property names are file paths (relative or absolute) and whose optional property values represent relative modification timestamps in seconds.
        encoding - Encoding.
        baseTimestamp - The base timestamp to use, in milliseconds since midnight on the 1st January 1970 GMT.
        Throws:
        IOException - If unable to create a file or a missing parent directory.
        NumberFormatException - If a non-empty property value cannot be parsed as an integer.

      • createResources

        public static void createResources(File baseDir,
                                   Properties properties,
                                   long baseTimestamp)
                            throws IOException
        Creates test resources defined by a specification file. The method creates all the files named by the properties, optionally setting the modification timestamp by adding the number of seconds specified by the property value (which must be an integer) to a base timestamp.
        Parameters:
        baseDir - The base directory against which to resolve relative paths.
        properties - A Properties object whose property names are file paths (relative or absolute) and whose optional property values represent relative modification timestamps in seconds.
        baseTimestamp - The base timestamp to use, in milliseconds since midnight on the 1st January 1970 GMT.
        Throws:
        IOException - If unable to create a file or a missing parent directory.
        NumberFormatException - If a non-empty property value cannot be parsed as an integer.
